title: Electric potential - at origin from Q and -4Q

content.question: Two charged particles are fixed in place in an <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-coordinate system, as shown in the figure. One particle has charge <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> and is located at <math alttext="the point with coordinates 0 comma d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>0</mn></mpadded><mo>,</mo><mpadded><mi>d</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>, and the other particle has charge <math alttext="negative 4 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> and is located at <math alttext="the point with coordinates 2 d comma 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></mpadded><mo>,</mo><mpadded><mn>0</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>. What is the electric potential at the origin due to the two particles?
